articles.title: Cyclone Fani lashes India's eastern coast

articles.description: The eastern state of Orissa is directly in the path of the storm.

articles.title: Main parties hit by Brexit backlash in polls
articles.content:
Media captionTory minister James Cleverly predicted it would be a "tough night" for his party
The Conservatives and Labour have faced a backlash at the ballot box over Brexit, with smaller parties and independents taking seats countrywide.
Results are comin… [+7830 chars]
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Lib Dems, Greens and independents make gains in the local elections. as Labour and the Tories suffer losses.

articles.title: The sacred water that makes a king
articles.content:
Image copyrightMinistry of CultureImage caption
 A mural depicting the coronation of Rama II
An elaborate three-day coronation is taking place for the king of Thailand, and sacred water plays a key role in the consecration rites.
The official ceremonies, a… [+4532 chars]
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The coronation of Thailand's Vajiralongkorn is an elaborate mix of Buddhist and Brahmin rituals.

articles.title: Cyclone Fani begins landfall in India
articles.content:
Image copyrightAFPImage caption
 Thousands have already sought shelter in relief centres
Cyclone Fani is making landfall along India's eastern coastline, according to the country's Meteorological Department. 
It is expected to reach wind speeds of 195 km/h… [+4220 chars]
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A million people have been evacuated, with the cyclone expected to hit at full force within hours.

articles.title: Pharma boss convicted in US opioid case
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty Images
The founder of Insys Therapeutics John Kapoor has become the first pharmaceutical boss to be convicted in a case linked to the US opioid crisis.
A Boston jury found Kapoor and four colleagues conspired to bribe doctors to prescri… [+1999 chars]
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Former billionaire John Kapoor was found guilty of bribing doctors to prescribe addictive painkillers.

articles.description: Hugely popular on social media, this secretive man known as StalinGulag has revealed his identity.

articles.title: Gay men on HIV drugs 'zero risk'
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty Images
Further evidence that taking anti-HIV drugs stops gay men passing on the virus to sexual partners has been called a "powerful message" which needs to be spread more widely.
A study of nearly 1,000 gay male couples in The Lancet f… [+4528 chars]
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A European study followed 972 male couples, where one was living with HIV, over an eight-year period.

articles.title: Chewbacca actor Peter Mayhew dies aged 74
articles.content:
Peter Mayhew, the actor who played Chewbacca in the Star Wars films, has died aged 74, his family says. 
He passed away at his home in Texas on 30 April with his family by his side, a statement said. They did not says what the cause of his death was.
Mayhew… [+434 chars]
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Peter Mayhew, the actor who played Chewbacca in the Star Wars films, has died aged 74 at his home in the US, his family says.

articles.title: 'I accidentally shot dead my little sister'
articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Sean was 10 when he found a gun at home and it went off, killing his younger sister and changing his life forever.
